name: sotol

[ C or U ] a plant that grows in hot, dry parts of the southern US and Mexico that has long, thick leaves with sharp points on them and tall flowers: Unlike agaves, sotols do not die after flowering. Sotol plants grow quite slowly and take years to blossom.
[ U ] a strong, alcoholic drink from Mexico, made from the sotol plant: Sotol is not just competition for tequila; it's part of northern Mexico's culture and history.
More examplesFewer examples"That's sotol," he said, pointing to a plant. "We use it to make walking sticks."The sotol plant is native to the Sonoran and Chihuahuan high desert climates and has long been a vital plant source of food and fibre. The key ingredient to sotol can be found growing in the Chihuahuan Desert.
